forecast.name: This Afternoon
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly sunny. High near 79, with temperatures falling to around 74 in the afternoon. West southwest wind around 7 mph.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Partly cloudy, with a low around 54. West southwest wind around 8 mph.

weather_report:
In Downtown San Francisco, the afternoon unfolds with a gentle warmth, a carpet of mostly sunny skies stretching overhead, whispering of springtime's arrival. The breeze, soft and unobtrusive, carries the unmistakable essence of the bay, clearing any residual haze that once lingered. The temperatures shoulder their way toward a comfortable peak of high seventies, yet they are destined to soften, settling around the mid-seventies as the sun begins its descent. There is a welcomed clarity to the day, free from the fog that often paints these streets; the Golden Gate Bridge stands proud against the backdrop, its arches inviting one’s gaze to linger.

As evening approaches, the atmosphere will shift gently into partly cloudy skies, wrapping the night in a soft embrace around fifty-four degrees. For those venturing out this afternoon, a light jacket or a warm sweater would serve well, shielding against the chill that emerges when the sun dips below the horizon. It is a splendid time to take a stroll along the waterfront or perhaps stop by a local café, savoring a warm beverage as the city starts to twinkle under the fading light. The invite from this vibrant urban canvas is clear: step outside, breathe in the freshness of the day, and enjoy the simple pleasures that a San Francisco afternoon has to offer.
